svt_axi_slave_addr_range Class Reference

Inheritance diagram for class svt_axi_slave_addr_range:

List of all members.

Detailed Description

Defines a range of address region identified by a starting address(start_addr) and end address(end_addr).

Member Function Documentation

  function svt_pattern
 svt_axi_slave_addr_range::do_allocate_pattern
 (   ) 

This method allocates a pattern containing svt_pattern_data instances for all of the primitive configuration fields in the object. The name is set to the corresponding field name, the value is set to 0.

Return values - An svt_pattern instance containing entries for all of the configuration fields.

  function void
 svt_axi_slave_addr_range::set_region_range
 (  bit [SVT_AXI_REGION_WIDTH-1:0] region_id , bit [SVT_AXI_MAX_ADDR_WIDTH-1:0] start_addr_region , bit [SVT_AXI_MAX_ADDR_WIDTH-1:0] end_addr_region , svt_axi_slave_region_range :: svt_axi_region_type_enum rtype , bit [SVT_AXI_ADDR_TAG_ATTRIBUTES_WIDTH-1:0] addr_attribute = 0  ) 

Set the region range for a specified slave within the specified address range.

region_id - Region Id for the specified address range.

  • Min value: 0
  • Max value: 15

start_addr_region - Start address for the region

end_addr_region - End address for the region

rtype - Region type of the specified region. Please refer to svt_axi_slave_region_range :: svt_axi_region_type_enum for allowed values.
